thread.title: A Closer Look At IBM's Future: Mobile, Security, Acquisitions And Accounting (Part 7)
thread.title_full: A Closer Look At IBM's Future: Mobile, Security, Acquisitions And Accounting (Part 7)

posts.title: A Closer Look At IBM's Future: Mobile, Security, Acquisitions And Accounting (Part 7)
posts.text:
Summary 
This article is part of a series of interviews with IBM executives. 
In this article, I ask IBM about its strategy in relation to mobile, security and acquisitions. 
I also investigate some of the accounting reclassifications. This article is part of a series of interviews with IBM . I started covering IBM on Seeking Alpha on the 4th of July 2016. At that time the stock was priced at $152. It is now worth $162.7, offering a gain of almost 7% plus 1.8% in dividends in about five months. At that time, I valued IBM between $179 and $219, I think that this valuation is still representative. In today's article, I report some remaining questions about IBM's strategic imperatives and about the M&A strategy, as well as some accounting questions raised by some Seeking Alpha readers. In my first article , I praised the turnaround of the company. I then had the opportunity to conduct interviews with IBM executives. In the first part of my interview with IBM, I tried to understand the long-term vision of the firm. I then elaborated on Watson, IBM's cognitive system. Here I disclosed my discussion with IBM's corporate team. I then had the chance to dig deeper and have a conversation with Rob High , IBM Watson CTO, and tried to shed some light on Watson's performance and business model . In my last two articles, I interviewed the CEO of InsightNG, a partner of the IBM Watson Ecosystem and Don Boulia VP of Cloud . Today, I start my interview asking details about mobile, social and security. These imperatives are relatively smaller compared to, for example, cloud but are still highly relevant. Can you please elaborate on what services IBM offers in terms of security? 
IBM Security offers consulting and services for the prevention, detection, remediation and management of security incidents. IBM both consults, runs and manages clients' security, including providing consulting IBM CISO's (Chief Information Security Officers) from our services team that work with the client company. IBM Security: is a $2B unit within IBM with 7,500+ people, with 12,000+ customers, within 133 countries and 19 acquisitions since 2002 is #1 in enterprise security software and services protects 80% of the Fortune 100 protects 75 of the world's largest financial services companies by revenue protects 8 of the 10 largest US Banks by consolidated assets 8 of the 10 largest US Healthcare companies by revenue protects 9 of the world's largest global telecom companies by revenue protects 22 of the 25 world's largest banks is used by 7 of the 10 largest US Electric & Utilities companies by market value is used by 20 of the top 25 US Retail Companies is used by 40 of the top 50 insurance companies of the world 
Most of IBM Security clients don't want to be a reference for fear of becoming a target for hackers, but we can share the following: The McGill University Health Centre : IBM and Trend Micro helps this healthcare provider rapidly detect and respond to attacks, analyzing at least 700 events per second. The University of New Brunswick : IBM QRadar is helping the university modernize its security architecture, increase virtualization and save costs. Concur Technologies : To protect mission-critical applications, IBM Security AppScan helps Concur test for source and production code. Although these are imperatives, their revenues are still very small. How does IBM plan to develop these segments? Are these segments performing as expected? Will they be left behind and dropped to focus on cloud and AI that seem to have momentum? 
We continued to see strong growth in 3Q for mobile (up 19 percent to $1.2 billion) and security (up 11 percent). This followed growth in 2Q for mobile (up 43 percent to $1 billion) and security (up 18 percent). So mobile is a $3 billion business YTD (up 42 percent) and security more than $1 billion (up 16 percent). These are important businesses for us. 
Many analysts, including analyst firm Technology Business Research, have identified IBM as the global leader in security services and software. IBM is the fastest growing and leading security company for the enterprise (it's growing faster than the market). In addition, IBM is leading the move to true cognitive security with Watson for Cyber Security, which was announced in May. Watson is learning the nuances of security research findings and discovering patterns and evidence of hidden cyber-attacks and threats that could otherwise be missed. 
Given that it takes companies an average of 229 days to detect advanced persistent threats, and according to Juniper Research, cybercrime will become a $2.1 trillion dollar problem by 2019, IBM sees security as one of the critical areas companies should focus on. Acquisitions IBM is investing a substantial amount of capital into acquisitions. Can you please give us an indication of the rationale for each recent acquisition, what IBM plans to achieve/acquire with each of them and how is the integration going? 
IBM has made more than 30 acquisitions since the start of 2014. Most of these acquisitions fall within our strategic imperatives, and help IBM accelerate and scale quickly in those markets- for example, our most recent planned acquisition announcement for Promontory Financial Group will become our Watson Financial Services offering within our new Industry Platform business unit. 
Another example - we acquired Merge Healthcare (a medical imaging analyzing and processing company), which joined our Watson Health business unit because we want to bolster our clients' ability to analyze and cross-reference medical images against billions of data points already in the Watson Health Cloud. 
Our acquisition of the Weather Company's digital properties seemed odd at first glance, but if you dig a little deeper, you'll realize there is rich data related to the weather. The weather affects every single industry and every single company. IBM will license weather forecast data and analytics to clients. You can also look at our Cleversafe acquisition and how it fits into our cloud strategy. Cleversafe is a developer and manufacturer of object-based storage software and appliances. We brought it into our cloud business to give our clients better data flexibility and cloud deployment options. Can you give an indication of IBM's future acquisition strategies? How much does it plan to invest, which type of companies? 
We don't disclose any future acquisition plans. However, as mentioned above, our focus has been on strategic imperatives - cloud (e.g., video, object storage); data (i.e., Merge Healthcare); platforms (e.g., The Weather Company); and deep vertical industry expertise (e.g., Promontory Financial Group). Accounting reclassification From the latest financial reports, I can see that the segment reporting of IBM is changing. This of course creates problems for comparison. Would you be able to provide historical revenues and operating profits for each strategic imperative for the last few years on a comparable basis (maybe 2/3 years)? 
The point with the new reporting structure is to provide better insight into the business as we go through our transformation. We expect the new structure will help investors understand where we are making investments and where we are seeing returns. 
You can find historical data using the reclassified segments for 2014 and 2015 using this link . These are for the five segments that IBM began using in 1Q 2016 
This point has been raised by a Seeking Alpha reader and I think it makes sense. I looked into the link and I did not find any issue with the reporting. I would be interested to see whether readers spot any inconsistency. In addition, could you explain why Transaction Processing Software has been moved inside Cognitive Solutions, the two don't seem to be related. 
TPS is in Cognitive Solutions because it performs functions similar to the solutions software that is also part of CS. Operating system SW is in the Systems segment; cloud software is in the Technology Services and Cloud Platform segment. 
While Cognitive Solutions includes Watson Health and Watson IOT, which are today taking advantage of IBM's cognitive technologies. It is a segment where we are building platforms. Today analytics, which is the largest part of our solutions software portfolio includes the traditional analytics platform, industry solutions and the Watson-related businesses. TPS runs mission critical systems in industries like banking, airlines and retail. Systems/hardware These segments are losing revenues at a rapid pace, what is IBM plan in relation to them? Will IBM divest, keep them as cash cows, fight the decline, sell them or? 
Our systems performance reflects both product cycle dynamics in z Systems and portfolio transitions in Power and storage. Power systems reflects the declining UNIX market and growth in an expanding Linux market. At the same time our Systems business is delivering important technologies and capabilities that enable us to address the cognitive and cloud opportunities. As always, thank you for reading. Although I will keep analyzing IBM, this is probably the last article of this series. I hope you enjoyed it. If you wish to follow my future articles just click the " Follow " button next to my name at the top. I would also be interested to know what you think about IBM recent earnings' release and its future prospects. Finally, if you are would like me to cover a particular company please let me know in the comments. Thank you for reading! Elsewhere on Seeking Alpha

thread.title: IBM: Will The Biggest Disrupter In Business Be Boring, Old Big Blue?
thread.title_full: IBM: Will The Biggest Disrupter In Business Be Boring, Old Big Blue?

posts.title: IBM: Will The Biggest Disrupter In Business Be Boring, Old Big Blue?
posts.text:
IBM is developing an incredible value proposition for the banking space. 
Huge brand recognition and cloud infrastructure put the company in an enviable position. 
Investors, this is why you should prepare to capture a deluge of cash over the coming years. Over International Business Machines Corp.'s (NYSE: IBM ) 105-year history, its many services and several scandals have been written about enough to fill enough books and articles to satisfy even the most voracious reader for months' worth of reading. Many readers know me for a focus on the investment's ability to generate cash and for my sometimes-habit of rating companies based on the safety of their dividend. I'll cover these factors for IBM's case in the next section. What I'm excited to share with you today is an enormous business opportunity the company is gearing up to exploit in the coming years. The essence of the technology I'm introducing in this article has been touched on many times, but the implications for the economy and the IBM investor have not been well elaborated by the mainstream journalist nor analysts. I hope to bring some light to this topic for my readers today. This article will touch on IBM's financial position, its foray into blockchain technology, and why the blockchain is likely to generate cash-like gangbusters for the firm. Summary Financial Information IBM has been in business since 1911 (then operating under the clumsy name The Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company until 1924). The firm has a history of consistently paying its dividend, a history reaching back to 1987. Today, its 29-year record of consistent dividend payments looks poised to continue as free cash flows certainly cover the annual payout schedule of $5.33B. Click to enlarge Source: Faloh Investment While the company's yield, standing at 3.44%, isn't stupendous in its own right, it handily beats many of its big league peers. Click to enlarge Source: Faloh Investment In terms of financial security, IBM is well positioned. The dividend is well secured by free cash flow, and there's even room for the company to grow the distribution if it chooses to do so. The Blockchain The most exciting technology. The blockchain concept and first implementation - both pioneered by Australian software engineer Craig Wright - have made waves in several places. Many of them illicit; the bitcoin "alternative currency" having had so few observers for the longest time became widely used for transactions in the black markets dealing various drugs and services. The seedy uses of the blockchain-based bitcoin currency aren't a result of an inherent evil in the new technology. But rather the result of the utility of the blockchain combined with its long-time obscurity from the eyes of law enforcement. What Is The Utility Of A Blockchain? First I'll note: There is not just one blockchain. Just like there is not just one brand of soda. There is the IBM-Blockchain, the Bitcoin-Blockchain, and so on. The function of this technology is to act as a secure ledger for transactions and as a storehouse of data. Additionally, anyone with access to a particular segment of a blockchain can view all of the transactions and data recorded therein. Now, the utility. A business really only makes money on the utility its product or service offers to individuals in the marketplace. In the case of an IBM-Blockchain, it plans to offer its brand of the technology to the banking industry. Here's what it will do for IBM's clients: Save money on document transfer and verification Streamline and eliminate ambiguity in multi-party transactions Speed up transactions More details on the blockchain from IBM are available here. How the IBM-Blockchain will continuously earn money for the company: It will retain ultimate control over access to its blockchain The company will add value with ongoing data hosting, connectivity, and security updates IBM will earn money through subscription and access fees When It Comes To Rolling Out Blockchain Technology, IBM May Be The Best Positioned Company On The Planet 
IBM is ... the world's most essential company. Our core systems run 90 percent of the top 60 banks and 80 percent of airline reservations. Seventy percent of the world's business data is managed by our mainframes. - Ginni Rometty, Chairman, President, and CEO, IBM Major banks and airlines already know and do business with IBM. This puts the company in a position to integrate this product into its offer, whether in contract renewals, or as part of its policy of continuous contact with its clients. Why This Is A Major Growth Opportunity For IBM - Not Just A Growth Opportunity Having another product to sell many of its existing clients is not the only benefit. As I mentioned before, the blockchain acts as a secure general ledger and will be used to speed up transactions. Every participant in a transaction will need access to the blockchain host of that specific transaction. The market opportunity for the IBM-Blockchain is therefore more expansive than service to the banking sector. It gives IBM a reach into everyone who does business with the banking sector! Finance-related businesses from Main Street to Wall Street will be compelled and even prefer to do business over the dominant blockchain as it speeds up transactions, saves money on paperwork, reduces time wasted on back-and-forth authentications, and increases security. The fundamental expansion in the number of clients IBM will have the opportunity to serve as a result of this upcoming product turns this up from a growth opportunity to a major growth opportunity. Summary Very, very many words have been written on the transformational power of the blockchain. For more detail on how this technology serves when underpinning transactions, I recommend you read the Wall Street Journal's What The Blockchain Is And What It Can Do . The business opportunity for IBM is enormous because of its established relationships with the very clients who will create a widespread need for access to the blockchain among their own clients. It's akin to free marketing and a built-in captive customer base for IBM's product. The company's size and enduring brand are significant factors which will lead the big banks to adopt the IBM-Blockchain rather than any competitor's. Economically, the profit margin on the IBM-Blockchain is likely to be substantial. The product is essentially an electronic data service. Ongoing capital needs will therefore be minimal. IBM's ongoing and aggressive expansion of its data center capacity actually represent investment into the future - the blockchain roll-out - not just a catch-up game for competing with other cloud programs, such as the wildly successful Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN ) Web Services. Takeaway IBM's stock has rallied over 30% from a recent low of $117.85 per share and still offers a secure annual yield of 3.44%. The IBM-Blockchain represents a huge cash-generating opportunity just around the corner. I rate IBM a buy based on my research and the factors discussed in this article. One caution: It may be a couple more years before all of these benefits are realized in the form of additional cash on IBM's bottom line. IBM is a long-term dividend growth investment opportunity. Additional Disclosure: This article represents the opinion of the author as of the date of this article. This article is based upon information reasonably available to the author and obtained from public sources that the author believes are reliable. However, the author does not guarantee the accuracy or completeness of this article. It is merely the author's interpretation of the information contained in the article. The author may close his investment position at any point in time without providing notice. The author encourages all readers to do their own due diligence. This is not a recommendation to buy or sell a security. Please click the + icon next to my user name and follow me, Faloh Investment , as I work to keep you informed on further developments in the world of dividend growth stocks. Disclosure: I/we have no positions in any stocks mentioned, but may initiate a long position in IBM over the next 72 hours. I wrote this article myself, and it expresses my own opinions. I am not receiving compensation for it (other than from Seeking Alpha). I have no business relationship with any company whose stock is mentioned in this article. thread.title: Thomson and Aeromexico latest to join the chatbot army
thread.title_full: Thomson and Aeromexico latest to join the chatbot army

posts.author: Linda Fox
posts.title: Thomson and Aeromexico latest to join the chatbot army
posts.text:
Thomson is claiming a first with the launch of its virtual assistant using IBM’s Cloud platform and Watson technology.
The travel search service will enable customers to get immediate responses on suggestions for holiday destinations and experiences.
The tour operator says it’s trialling the tool, which uses natural language, following research showing 77% of people feel a virtual assistant would be useful in holiday search.
So far, the chatbot can be used via Firefox and Google Chrome.
Over time, Thomson says the service will continue to develop as customer feedback is used to improve responses.
IBM Watson has been developed to learn through interaction and therefore become smarter with its responses.
Jeremy Osborne, director of strategic innovation for Thomson-parent TUI UK & Ireland, says:
“By leveraging IBM Cloud Technology with Watson’s cognitive intelligence, we are raising the bar in the travel industry. We are delivering an interactive service experiment to our customers that offers holiday inspiration ideas and personalised search results based on customer interests.
Thomson is not the only travel company to be using the technology with travel discovery service Wayblazer an early leader with the technology.
Wayblazer announced back in January that Trisept Solutions would be integrating the technology into its travel agency desktop system.
In June, Singapore-based Zumata announced it was working with IBM Watson serve up personalised hotel results on third party sites.
A number of industry players, including airlines and online travel agencies, have launched chatbot services in recent months.
One of the most recent is Aeromexico with its Aerobot service which enables travellers to search for flights via Facebook Messenger.
The service, which is powered by customer experience specialist Yalo , enables flight search of Aeromexico and partner flights with users transferred to the airline’s website for booking.
Available in English and Spanish, Aerobot also provides flight status updates and answers frequently asked questions such as luggage allowance.
Aeromexico’s vice president of ecommerce Brian Gross says:
“Conversational commerce is about to go big in North America and across the world. But also, Mexicans are among the most avid users in the world of chat apps and of Facebook.
“73% of Mexican Facebook users already contact their favorite companies via Facebook. Our customers already use and love these channels, so we want to be there too. And eventually, we’ll be able to service our customers who use artificial intelligence assistants like Google Home and Amazon Echo.”

thread.title: IBM i Customers get Ultimate Security Option, as Flynet Partner Raz-Lee Security
thread.title_full: IBM i Customers get Ultimate Security Option, as Flynet Partner Raz-Lee Security

posts.title: IBM i Customers get Ultimate Security Option, as Flynet Partner Raz-Lee Security
posts.text:
IBM i Customers get Ultimate Security Option, as Flynet Partner Raz-Lee Security Share Article Flynet announce a technical alliance with Raz-Lee Security, marking a new era in IBM i operations security. Flynet Terminal Emulator Our technical alliance with Flynet will allow our customers to enjoy worry free access, modernization and liberation of their IBM i applications and platform- Eli Spitz, Raz-Lee (PRWEB UK) 23 November 2016 With mounting, industry, professional and market regulations, security is becoming a growing concern. Companies in all industries, especially finance and health-related sectors, are increasingly challenged to proactively secure, monitor and report all activities related to potential security breaches.This has been a particular challenge with legacy applications, including those running on the IBM i. The majority of terminal emulators used to access such applications rely on Java applets or ActiveX plugins, both seen as a security risk.This recent technical alliance combines the KPMG penetration tested Flynet Viewer web based terminal emulator , Flynet Viewer legacy modernisation tools and Raz-Lee’s iSecurity Suite of security, auditing, encryption and compliance solutions, offering IBM i users an unparalleled level of both application and system security. Eli Spitz, VP Business Development at Raz-Lee said: “The technical alliance with Flynet will allow customers to enjoy worry free access, modernisation and liberation of their IBM i applications and platform. The Flynet web based terminal emulator allows users to access their IBM i applications from any device, the 100% pure html emulator doesn’t present a conventional threat surface to would be attackers, couple this with the Flynet framework acting in a “well behaved state” means that users can add additional security without making any compromises on availability or functionality”. Christian Rule Director of Business Transformation, Flynet “Raz-Lee’s credentials are second to none, with partners and customers in more than 40 countries worldwide. Flynet are proud to be recognised by Raz-Lee as offering a uniquely secure access and modernisation platform for IBM i. The combination of the respective technologies offers IBM i owners a way to administer, modernise and access applications from any device. Mobile and SOA projects can be delivered securely and with ease, greatly reducing the time to value whilst offering a level of threat mitigation not previously possible.” “Flynet’s browser based terminal emulation solution installs server side in about 15 minutes, deploying to an entire enterprise in seconds. The solution allows users to access the host from any web browser, on any device. It’s client agnostic and does not require any plug-ins, applets or client side software installation. The Flynet Studio UX application allows users to convert green screens to web UIs or web services in a tenth of the nearest alternative, what’s more it doesn’t require any coding at all. The combination of Flynet and Raz-Lee is the most secure, robust and quickest way for IBM i owners to answer the needs of the modern enterprise from mobile to IoT and beyond”. About Flynet Flynet is an established enterprise software company based in Cambridge. Future proofing legacy applications across all industries. Its software solutions deliver terminal emulation, modernisation and migration for host, legacy and heritage systems (mainframe, IBM i, IBM p, Unix, VMS, VAX, PICK and MultiValue) in days not years. Flynet’s KPMG penetration tested, cloud ready, mobile solutions de-risk legacy modernisation and migration projects. About Raz-Lee Security Raz-Lee Security, headquartered in Nanuet, New York, is the leading provider of security, auditing, encryption and compliance solutions for IBM i (AS/400) systems. Drawing upon its more than 30 years of expertise in the IBM i Performance and Optimization market, Raz-Lee designs, develops and markets a comprehensive suite of more than 20 software solutions - iSecurity.

posts.title: IBM i Customers get Ultimate Security Option, as Flynet Partner Raz-Lee Security
posts.text:
November 23, 2016 at 08:00 AM EST IBM i Customers get Ultimate Security Option, as Flynet Partner Raz-Lee Security 
Flynet announce a technical alliance with Raz-Lee Security, marking a new era in IBM i operations security. 
(PRWEB UK) 23 November 2016 
With mounting, industry, professional and market regulations, security is becoming a growing concern. Companies in all industries, especially finance and health-related sectors, are increasingly challenged to proactively secure, monitor and report all activities related to potential security breaches.This has been a particular challenge with legacy applications, including those running on the IBM i. 
The majority of terminal emulators used to access such applications rely on Java applets or ActiveX plugins, both seen as a security risk.This recent technical alliance combines the KPMG penetration tested Flynet Viewer web based terminal emulator , Flynet Viewer legacy modernisation tools and Raz-Lee’s iSecurity Suite of security, auditing, encryption and compliance solutions, offering IBM i users an unparalleled level of both application and system security. 
Eli Spitz, VP Business Development at Raz-Lee said: “The technical alliance with Flynet will allow customers to enjoy worry free access, modernisation and liberation of their IBM i applications and platform. The Flynet web based terminal emulator allows users to access their IBM i applications from any device, the 100% pure html emulator doesn’t present a conventional threat surface to would be attackers, couple this with the Flynet framework acting in a “well behaved state” means that users can add additional security without making any compromises on availability or functionality”. 
Christian Rule Director of Business Transformation, Flynet “Raz-Lee’s credentials are second to none, with partners and customers in more than 40 countries worldwide. Flynet are proud to be recognised by Raz-Lee as offering a uniquely secure access and modernisation platform for IBM i. The combination of the respective technologies offers IBM i owners a way to administer, modernise and access applications from any device. Mobile and SOA projects can be delivered securely and with ease, greatly reducing the time to value whilst offering a level of threat mitigation not previously possible.” 
“Flynet’s browser based terminal emulation solution installs server side in about 15 minutes, deploying to an entire enterprise in seconds. The solution allows users to access the host from any web browser, on any device. It’s client agnostic and does not require any plug-ins, applets or client side software installation. The Flynet Studio UX application allows users to convert green screens to web UIs or web services in a tenth of the nearest alternative, what’s more it doesn’t require any coding at all. The combination of Flynet and Raz-Lee is the most secure, robust and quickest way for IBM i owners to answer the needs of the modern enterprise from mobile to IoT and beyond”. 
About Flynet Flynet is an established enterprise software company based in Cambridge. Future proofing legacy applications across all industries. Its software solutions deliver terminal emulation, modernisation and migration for host, legacy and heritage systems (mainframe, IBM i, IBM p, Unix, VMS, VAX, PICK and MultiValue) in days not years. 
Flynet’s KPMG penetration tested, cloud ready, mobile solutions de-risk legacy modernisation and migration projects. 
About Raz-Lee Security Raz-Lee Security, headquartered in Nanuet, New York, is the leading provider of security, auditing, encryption and compliance solutions for IBM i (AS/400) systems. Drawing upon its more than 30 years of expertise in the IBM i Performance and Optimization market, Raz-Lee designs, develops and markets a comprehensive suite of more than 20 software solutions - iSecurity. 
For the original version on PRWeb visit: http://www.prweb.com/releases/2016/11/prweb13873307.htm Nasdaq quotes delayed at least 15 minutes, all others at least 20 minutes. thread.title: IBMVoice: Cognitive Health Care: How Watson IoT Could Transform Your Next Hospital Stay
thread.title_full: IBMVoice: Cognitive Health Care: How Watson IoT Could Transform Your Next Hospital Stay

posts.author: IBM Contributor, IBM
posts.title: IBMVoice: Cognitive Health Care: How Watson IoT Could Transform Your Next Hospital Stay
posts.text:
Bret Greenstein, IBM 
In the United States, the privatized healthcare system allows patients to choose where to go for their treatments. There is real competition among hospitals. As a result, patients and their families increasingly expect an excellent “customer experience” — in the hospital. 
Thomas Jefferson University Hospitals, Inc. in Philadelphia and Harman International have long realized this trend and have cultivated an innovation team to look at how new technologies can improve the experience of patients and their loved ones. 
The Cognitive Concierge in Your Hospital Room 
Earlier this year, IBM Watson IoT , Thomas Jefferson University Hospitals, Inc. and Harman International formulated an idea about the future of healthcare. They envisioned a hospital setting where patients can speak naturally to a cognitive concierge in their hospital room that will be able to answer questions, adjust their environment, and anticipate their preferences. 
Very soon after those early conversations, the teams got to work on a pilot project to produce a working prototype of a cognitive environment of care where we can all get a glimpse into the future of healthcare. 
Imagine a family standing around a hospital bed. The patient turns to a speaker: “I am cold! Please make it a bit warmer in the room. Oh, and please raise the blinds for more light.” 
As if by magic, the room complies with the request. The patient then asks “What’s for lunch today?” and hears a menu of options. A visitor then asks, “Please tell me about the doctor looking after my family member” or, “What are the visiting hours tomorrow?” 
You get the idea. This prototype is just the beginning. There is a deeper trend of making technology fade into the background to the point where the patients’ experiences become about natural engagement and interaction with the environment. It is not a far stretch to foresee that cognitive-assisted services will supplement all manners of care in offering a more personalized healthcare experience. 
Introducing “Cognitive Care” 
Voice assistance is giving way to “cognitive care,” which can apply to patients at a hospital, seniors at home, students at school, or any service provider that requires individual attention. 
For example, a cognitive system — combined with the Internet of Things — can interact through objects in seniors’ homes, learn and anticipate their habits and needs, and offer guidance or encouragement at the right time and place. 
With cognitive care at home, elderly people living alone can be more independent and can receive reminders for appointments and medications. They can access care services by means of voice commands. And their family and caregivers can feel assured that they will be alerted of any issues or changes to their health or wellbeing. 
The amazing thing about the technology is that it can answer questions and execute requests that are very specific to the context of the user. This is possible because IBM Watson can correlate information across building systems, patient records, CRM systems and administrative records. 
Watson can draw patterns and remember preferences for follow-up visits, allowing for an engaging and interactive experience for patients. Patients are provided with a responsive, cognitive and personalized environment of care — when they need it most. 
To usher in the Cognitive Era, we are working with leading thinkers and innovators, such as Thomas Jefferson University Hospital and Harman International, to put the experience of patients above all else. While I would not say that I look forward to sitting in a hospital room, I will say that use of our cognitive IoT solutions could make a real difference in people’s lives when they do need to be in a hospital. 
Tweet this: 
Bret Greenstein is the Vice President of IBM Watson Internet of Things Platform.

thread.title: Blog Coverage IBM Expands its Financial Infrastructure and Acquires Promontory Financial
thread.title_full: Blog Coverage IBM Expands its Financial Infrastructure and Acquires Promontory Financial - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

posts.author: cbs8
posts.title: Blog Coverage IBM Expands its Financial Infrastructure and Acquires Promontory Financial
posts.text:
Upcoming AWS Coverage on Fidelity National Information Services Post-Earnings Results
LONDON, UK / ACCESSWIRE / November 23, 2016 / Active Wall St. blog coverage looks at the headline from International Business Machines Corp. (NYSE: IBM ) as the company announced on November 22, 2016, that it has closed the acquisition of Promontory Financial Group, a global financial consultancy. Promontory Financial deals with risk management and regulatory compliance consulting where it is one of the best-connected and most commanding in the segment. Register with us now for your free membership and blog access at: http://www.activewallst.com/register/ .
One of International Business Machines’ competitors within the Information Technology Services space, Fidelity National Information Services, Inc. (NYSE: FIS ), reported on November 01, 2016, Q3 2016 results. AWS will be initiating a research report on Fidelity National Information Services in the coming days.
Today, AWS is promoting its blog coverage on IBM; touching on FIS. Get all of our free blog coverage and more by clicking on the link below:
http://www.activewallst.com/registration-3/?symbol=IBM
http://www.activewallst.com/registration-3/?symbol=FIS
This acquisition brings a new collaborative unit into existence, where, Promontory consultants and IBM’s flagship artificial-intelligence technology would work on the same platform to develop solutions and advise clients on matters concerning financial regulation.
The merger – Explained
Promontory Financial is a deeply skilled community of 600 professionals based across different continents and boasts a pool of talented financial experts brought together over decades. The firm gained significance after the 2008 financial crisis, where, it advised institutions on the matter at hand. The firm’s expertise and offerings directly address the standards for compliance implemented to ensure the integrity of the financial system, protect consumers, and build trust through transparency.
The workload arising from new regulatory requirements is ever-increasing and according to a projection, the complete catalog of regulations is set to exceed 300 million pages by the end of 2020. Seemingly, the human workforce is of little use in this sector, where the total costs of managing the regulatory environment exceed $270 billion per year.
Watson, the latest API-based solution enables cognition build-up in the app or product infrastructure. Its flagship data interpretation technologies are set to revolutionize the current financial services, with many speculating it as the future of the regulatory environment.
IBM’s initiative to deliver financial solutions
IBM has taken a step towards positioning Watson, an artificial intelligence platform, as a future strategy. This acquisition of the consulting group, Promontory Financial will bolster the development of the Watson Financial Services Group. In a recent dialogue with the Wall Street Journal, IBM senior VP Bridget Van Kranlingen stated that the financial world was data-driven and this acquisition was quite logical as it is an expansion of Watson’s cognitive computing technology.
IBM acquired EZSource on June 1, 2016, where the application discovery company was blended in IBM’s app-development and services infrastructure. Seemingly, this acquisition with Promontory Financial was long-planned ones and IBM ensured that it had efficient resources to judiciously extract maximum productivity and value for its AI platform.
Promontory Financial’s professional will be tasked with training Watson, by feeding it regulatory information periodically and through interactions in real-world applications. The solutions include regulatory expectations, obligations, and control requirements, specific compliance needs such as insider threat, counter fraud, and consumer complaint databases.
This collaboration midst the Promontory Financial’s experts and IBM’s Watson platform will aim at developing a smarter solution to find and regulate suspicious transactions and customers, which the firm ultimately plans to sell to banks.
The financial details of the acquisition were not released, and Promontory Financial would operate as a wholly owned subsidiary of IBM.
Stock Performance
At the closing bell, on Tuesday, November 22, 2016, International Business Machines’ stock marginally fell 0.06%, ending the trading session at $162.67. A total volume of 2.77 million shares were traded at the end of the day. The company’s stock price advanced 9.02% in the last month, 3.20% in the past three months, and 9.15% in the previous six months. Moreover, the stock surged 22.71% since the start of the year. The company’s shares are trading at a PE ratio of 13.26 and have a dividend yield of 3.44%.

The Global Network Outsourcing market size is poised to grow at a CAGR of 6.12% over the period 2014 to 2022. posts.title: IBM Closes Buyout of Regulatory Compliance Firm Promontory - November 23, 2016 - Zacks.com
posts.text:
IBM Closes Buyout of Regulatory Compliance Firm Promontory by Zacks Equity Research Published on November 23, 2016 International Business Machines Corporation ( IBM - Free Report ) has announced the completion of its acquisition of Promontory Financial Group, a leading risk management and regulatory compliance consulting firm. What Led to the Acquisition? Today, financial regulations and risk management requirements are changing rapidly. These demand substantial operational efforts and costs to keep pace with. With Promontory’s expertise in the aforementioned field, the acquisition is likely to strengthen IBM’s capabilities going ahead. Additionally, with Watson that is equipped with cognitive capabilities, IBM will be able to speed up its development of cognitive solutions for compliance and risk management. 
INTL BUS MACH Price 
INTL BUS MACH Price | INTL BUS MACH Quote What Does this Mean for IBM? The Promontory acquisition will complement the Industry Platforms business of IBM, which has been created to offer “as a service” offerings custom built for individual industries. We note that, this will combine the benefits of the IBM Cloud, Watson and industry specific capabilities of specialized providers to achieve enhanced efficiency, security, quality and transparency while lowering operational costs. In other words, IBM is trying to strengthen its presence in the cloud business that is gathering steam with every passing day. As per an IDC report, worldwide spending on cognitive systems is estimated to reach over $31 billion by 2019 growing at a CAGR of 55%. Notably, the banking sector alone will account for 20% share of the total spending on cognitive systems. Intensifying Competition We note that competition is intensifying in the financial regulations and risk management segment with the presence of players such as ICI Consulting, Primatics Financial, LLC and Resources Global Professionals. However, the Promontory deal puts IBM in good stead among its peers. Zacks Rank & Key Picks At present, IBM has a Zacks Rank #3 (Hold). Some better-ranked stocks in the broader technology space are Applied Optoelectronics, Inc. ( AAOI - Free Report ) , Acacia Communications, Inc. ( ACIA - Free Report ) and Advanced Energy Industries, Inc. ( AEIS - Free Report ) , each sporting a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy). You can see the complete list of today’s Zacks #1 Rank stocks here . Notably, the consensus estimate for Applied Optoelectronics’ current year improved to 81 cents from 51 cents over the last 30 days. The consensus estimate for Acacia’s current year improved to $2.33 from $2.28 over the last 30 days. Last but not the least, the consensus estimate for Advanced Energy’s current year improved to $2.67 from $2.51 over the last 30 days. Goldman Sachs' Most Meaningful Short Positions List ExxonMobil tops the rankings   XOM +0% IBM +0% T +0% CAT +0% GE +0% PG +0% ABT +0% DIS +0% BA +0% FCX +0% DLR +0% AZO +0% CVX +0% 
Data on the most meaningful short positions that count to hedge funds have been composed by Goldman Sachs Global Investment Research from the source FactSet. These data can be found on zerohedge.com . 
According to aforementioned sources, ExxonMobil Corp. ( NYSE:XOM ) is the leader of the ranking that covers "50 stocks representing important short positions" with a value of short interest of $4.5 billion as of Oct. 31. 
ExxonMobil is tailgated by International Business Machines Corp. ( NYSE:IBM ) with a value of short interest of $3.7 billion. 
The other top 10 stocks that occupy the ranking representing the most significant stock shares volume that have been sold short but not bought back yet by investors are AT&T Inc. ( NYSE:T ) and Caterpillar Inc. ( NYSE:CAT ) with a value of short interest of $3.6 billion, Chevron Corp. ( NYSE:CVX ) with $3.5 billion, Boeing Co. ( NYSE:BA ) with $3.3 billion, General Electric Co. ( NYSE:GE ) with $3.2 billion, Procter & Gamble Co. ( NYSE:PG ) and Abbott Laboratories ( NYSE:ABT ) with a value of short interest of $3.0 billion and Walt Disney Co. ( NYSE:DIS ) that closes the top 10 stocks group with a value of short interest of $2.9 billion.   XOM 
If the first 10 ranking positions were sorted out according to the short interest computed as a percentage of float capital that is dividing the value of shares sold short by the value of shares available for trading, the first position would be occupied by Caterpillar with a ratio of 7% as of Oct. 31, followed by Abbott Laboratories with a ratio of 5% and Boeing with a ratio of 4%. 
Caterpillar has 585.07 million shares outstanding and approximately 99.84% of it is available for trading of the New York Stock Exchange. This means that approximately 40.89 million shares of Caterpillar have been sold short by investors and still not bought back. 
Concerning Abbott Laboratories a volume of approximately 73.5 million shares have been sold short on a float of 1.47 billion shares available for trading on the New York Stock Exchange. 
With a ratio of 4%, approximately 23 million shares of Boeing have been sold short on a total of 574.82 million of shares available for trading on the New York Stock Exchange. 
Bringing up the ranking’s rear is occupied by those stocks that have a value of short interest of $1.3 billion. Of these stocks worth mentioning are Freeport-McMoRan ( NYSE:FCX ) and Digital Realty Trust ( NYSE:DLR ) because their short interest ratios calculated as a percentage of float cap is 10% which is the highest in the overall ranking even though it cannot be seen as a prediction of increasing pessimistic market feeling on these three stocks. A red flag is usually raised when this ratio is more than 25%. 
AutoZone Inc. ( NYSE:AZO ), a U.S. retailer that distributes automotive replacement parts, occupies the upper middle of the ranking with a short interest of 9% and a value of $2.0 billion.

posts.title: IBM, HPE and T-Systems compete for Europe-wide €5.3m hybrid cloud contract
posts.text:
T-Systems, along with IBM and Hewlett Packard Enterprise (HPE), is being sounded out by Cern as a potential supplier of its €5.3m Helix Nebula hybrid cloud platform for the European science community.   Your exclusive guide to CIO trends 
A collection of our most popular articles for IT leaders from the first few months of 2016, including: - Corporate giants recruit digitally-minded outsiders to drive transformation - Analytics platforms to drive strategy in 2016 - Next generation: The changing role of IT leaders. By submitting your personal information, you agree that TechTarget and its partners may contact you regarding relevant content, products and special offers. You also agree that your personal information may be transferred and processed in the United States, and that you have read and agree to the Terms of Use and the Privacy Policy . 
Twenty-eight firms from 12 countries are understood to have submitted bids to provide the infrastructure to support the project, following the publication of a pre-commercial procurement tender earlier in 2016. 
This list has since been whittled down to four consortia of suppliers that have submitted their design ideas for the project. Of these, three will be asked to build a prototype platform during the next phase of the procurement process. 
IBM is going it alone on its design for the project, while T-Systems is partnering with Huawei and several others to create its platform . The company is also involved in Rhea Group’s bid. The fourth and final group features HPE, Advania, Sixsq and Indra. 
As previously reported by Computer Weekly , Cern is one of 10 European research organisations backing the project, which is geared towards providing scientific researchers from across the continent with on-demand access to big data and high performance computing (HPC) capabilities. 
The organisations said they are seeking to combine commercial cloud services with publicly funded infrastructures and participants’ own in-house IT resources to create the Helix Nebula hybrid cloud environment. 
T-Systems has confirmed its suggested design will be based on its Openstack-based Open Telekom Cloud service . The offering draws on the communications network of its parent company, Deutsche Telekom, and features networking kit from Huawei. 
The offering is already used to provide public cloud services to enterprises, small to medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) and public sector organisation across the continent. Read more about cloud computing in the science community Joe Gray from the Oregon Health and Science University explains how its cloud-based cancer research project with Intel is progressing. Microsoft is donating $5m worth of cloud computing capacity to The Alan Turing Institute’s research teams to support their data science work.cer research project with Intel is progressing. 
Bob Jones, leader of the Helix Nebula initiative at Cern, said one thing all of the selected consortia share is their commitment to innovation. 
“We are very pleased with the response to the tender and we would like to thank all the organisations that took the effort of submitting a bid. We realised it was a lot of work for those companies and we want to acknowledge it,” he said. CW+ Enjoy the benefits of CW+ membership, learn more and join. E-Zine

thread.title: Cyrus Mistry issues statement: Ratan Tata tried to sell TCS to IBM; made Corus buy costly | The Indian Express
thread.title_full: Cyrus Mistry issues statement: Ratan Tata tried to sell TCS to IBM; made Corus buy costly | The Indian Express

posts.author: Ens Economic Bureau
posts.title: Cyrus Mistry issues statement: Ratan Tata tried to sell TCS to IBM; made Corus buy costly | The Indian Express
posts.text:
Cyrus Mistry issues statement: Ratan Tata tried to sell TCS to IBM; made Corus buy costly Cyrus Mistry issues statement: Ratan Tata tried to sell TCS to IBM; made Corus buy costly Ratan Tata also decided to back CDMA as platform for telecom business, against his team’s advice: Mistry By: ENS Economic Bureau | Mumbai | Published:November 23, 2016 2:25 am Mistry’s latest salvo has come at a time when TCS has convened a shareholders’ meeting to remove Mistry as a director. 
Cyrus Mistry, who was ousted as the Tata Sons’ chairman last month, on Tuesday alleged that Ratan Tata tried to sell TCS, the cash cow of the $103-billion group, to IBM but the then group chairman JRD Tata refused to even discuss the proposal and turned it down. 
“Midway during the TCS journey to date, FC Kohli (who was then heading TCS) was suffering from a cardiac condition. Ratan Tata was then heading Tata Industries’ JV with IBM and approached JRD Tata with a proposal from IBM to buy out TCS. JRD Tata refused to discuss the deal because FC Kohli was still recovering in the hospital from his setback,” Mistry’s office alleged. On his return, Kohli assured JRD that TCS had a bright future and the group should not sell the company. “JRD Tata turned down the offer, demonstrating true vision. But, it was also a near-death experience for TCS at the hands of Ratan Tata,” Mistry said. 
Mistry also blamed Ratan Tata for the mess in its UK operations (Corus). Attacking Tata, Mistry said: “It is common knowledge that the decision to acquire Corus for over $12 billion, when only a year earlier it was available at less than half that price, was based on one man’s ego and against the reservations of some board members and senior executives.” 
Mistry said the excess payment made it harder to invest in the acquired assets which had been neglected, and thereby placed many jobs at risk. Similarly, in November 2003, Tata, against the advice of many of his own team members, decided to back CDMA as the platform for the group’s telecom business. “This strategic decision has led to a series of consequences that currently leave the company structurally challenged. Once again, one person’s judgment adversely affected the jobs of thousands,” Mistry’s statement said. 
Mistry’s latest salvo has come at a time when TCS has convened a shareholders’ meeting to remove Mistry as a director. 
According to Mistry, TCS had in FC Kohli a visionary founding CEO. “Today, N Chandrasekaran continues to provide strong and able leadership. Chandra, his leadership team, and the nearly 350,000 TCS employees have made us proud. Over the last 4 years, the TCS leadership team has engaged well, and complemented, the board. In his role as non-executive chairman, Mistry’s primary involvement with TCS has been focused on future-proofing TCS strategy and helping fortify their relationships at the C Suite level by leveraging the strength of the group,” it said. 
He said the high dependence on TCS in the Tata Sons portfolio is a well-known fact. “This was repeatedly flagged in strategy presentations to the Tata Sons board by Mistry. Apart from strengthening other group firms, Mistry maintained that keeping TCS strong and relevant is critical,” the statement said. 
“For TCS to flourish, it was vital that TCS transformed from an IT solutions provider to a strategic partner because the digital imperative had become a strategic differentiator for many organisations. Consequently, the client relationship needed to move from engaging with the CIO (with whom traditionally Indian IT company CEOs maintained their relationship) to the CEO,” he said. As chairman of Tata Sons and TCS, Mistry’s access to senior stakeholders across the world was an enabling platform. “Over the last 3 years, Mistry met at least 60 global CEOs, some along with TCS leadership, to reinforce the capabilities of TCS for organisations to co-innovate in the digital world,” the statement said. 
Like TCS, JLR is fortunate to benefit from the strong leadership of Ralf Speth and his leadership team, who lead the highly committed JLR employees, he said. “JLR is one of the strong performers for the group today. The significant efforts of Ravi Kant, former vice chairman of Tata Motors, who virtually camped overseas to see the integration through and lead the transformation, too deserves special mention. JLR is at a critical juncture. The decisions taken today will decide its future resilience,” he said. Best of Express

thread.title: IBM will build four new data centers in UK
thread.title_full: IBM will build four new data centers in UK

posts.author: Anthony Spadafora
posts.title: IBM will build four new data centers in UK
posts.text:
Tweet 
IBM has announced its commitment to a multi-million pound project that will see the company construct four new data centers in the UK to increase its cloud capabilities in the region. 
The company revealed its new project ahead of the Autumn Statement, which offered a boost to the Government that has recently seen a number of large US technology companies increasing their operations in the country. IBM's decision to create four new data centers will triple its cloud computing capacity in the UK. 
Companies that use the US company's data centers will gain access to their large amounts of storage and processing power. They will also be able to take advantage of IBM's own proprietary software such as its Watson artificial intelligence software. The company's customers in the region, which includes Boots and Dixons Carphone, have noted that IBM's new investment would make it the largest cloud network in Europe. When the project is completed, the company will have 16 data centers in the region with six of those located in the UK. 
Digital and cultural minister Matt Hancock applauded IBM's plan to offer more cloud data centers in the UK, saying: "Today's announcement by IBM is a further boost for this thriving area, and another vote of confidence which shows Britain is open for business. These new cloud data centers will help our firms work smarter and quicker to become the world-leading businesses of tomorrow". 
A number of other large technology companies have recently revealed their own plans to expand their UK operations. Facebook announced this week that it will build a new headquarters and hire 500 new staff members to fill its new London office space and Google said that it will higher 3,000 additional staff members in London by 2020.

thread.title: IBM employee quits to protest company’s overture to Donald Trump
thread.title_full: IBM employee quits to protest company’s overture to Donald Trump

posts.author: Ben Norton
posts.title: IBM employee quits to protest company’s overture to Donald Trump
posts.text:
Wednesday, Nov 23, 2016 7:55 PM UTC IBM employee quits to protest company’s overture to Donald Trump Marketing strategist Elizabeth Wood says she felt "deeply crushed" at IBM chief's overtures to Donald Trump Topics: Donald Trump , IBM , President Trump , Racism , Trump transition , Business News , News , Politics News (Credit: AP/Mark Lennihan) 
An employee at IBM has publicly resigned to protest the tech giant’s embrace of President-elect Donald Trump. 
Elizabeth Wood, a senior content strategist in IBM’s corporate marketing department, announced this week that she is stepping down, after CEO Ginni Rometty offered to help the far-right leader “advance a national agenda in a time of profound change.” 
Rometty published an open letter to Trump on Nov. 15, in which she expressed hope that they could “work together to achieve prosperity.” 
“I am writing to offer ideas that I believe will help achieve the aspiration you articulated,” the IBM chief wrote. She proposed ways in which the company could help the impending Trump administration create new jobs, build advanced infrastructure, reduce government inefficiency and make national investments. 
In reply to her boss, Wood published her own open letter this week, expressing concern that her company would embrace a politician who ran an overtly racist, xenophobic and misogynist campaign. 
“Your letter offered the backing of IBM’s global workforce in support of his agenda that preys on marginalized people and threatens my well-being as a woman, a Latina and a concerned citizen,” she wrote. 
Salon spoke with Elizabeth Wood about her experience. Over the phone, the former IBM employee sounded concerned, yet brave and committed to doing what is right. “I was really offended — really deeply crushed,” Wood explained. “This was such a welcoming letter that it was just really distressing.” 
“It felt like such a clear message to IBMers,” she added. That message: profit trumps people. 
Wood nevertheless spoke positively of her experience at IBM. “I did see a future in the company,” she said, noting she had not previously thought about leaving. She liked her job, and had worked there for roughly two years. “It took a while to get there,” Wood said. “But now, it doesn’t seem worth it to contribute that energy or give them that time, because it’s just, why — they don’t care about what, for so much of their own workforce, the real challenges and threats are.” Wood emphasized that, as a Latina woman, she feels especially threatened by the Trump administration her former employer has pledged to help. “The battle cry of Trump’s whole campaign has been this whole ‘build a wall’ nonsense,” she told Salon, noting that the billionaire has already surrounded himself with figures with extreme right-wing, bigoted ideologies. “A lot of people are scared. You can see it; you can feel it,” she added. “A lot of my peers are feeling powerless, saying, ‘I don’t know what to do.’ They are feeling threatened and unheard by this upcoming regime.” 
In her letter to President-elect Trump, Ginni Rometty conceded that “there will be issues on which we agree, and issues on which we do not.” Yet she also detailed ways in which IBM — which she points out is “the nation’s largest technology employer” — could help Trump accomplish some of his administration’s economic goals. And the CEO highlighted that her company works in more than 175 countries around the world. 
Wood expressed concerns about what such collaboration could mean. “IBM specifically has capabilities that will really aid in some of Trump’s more nefarious initiatives,” she said, citing the far-right administration’s pledge to carry out mass deportations and create a registry for Muslims. IBM does in fact have a precedent of working with ghastly regimes. In his book “ IBM and the Holocaust : The Strategic Alliance between Nazi Germany and America’s Most Powerful Corporation,” journalist Edwin Black detailed the past links between the powerful technology company and Adolf Hitler’s genocidal regime. Wood told Salon that she did not know about this history of Nazi collaboration, but commented, “It should serve as a warning to really consider when supporting political administrations like this.” The former IBM employee said she does not know what exactly she will do now; she did not have another job offer before resigning. But she feels confident that it was the right choice. Wood also made it clear that, although her open letter is addressed to Rometty, it is by no means only meant for her. “I know it wasn’t just her writing it; I’m sure there were many hands involved,” she said of the IBM CEO. Wood stressed that her warnings also apply to other corporations that plan to work with what will likely be an extreme and repressive Trump administration. Ben Norton is a politics reporter and staff writer at Salon. You can find him on Twitter at @BenjaminNorton .
